description: A biography of Alexander the Great and a history of his conquests, with many legends about him. Acquired from Brill, Leyden, A.D. 1900. Catalogus codicum manuscriptorum orientalium (1846), 707-9; Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 9109; Catalogue des manuscrits arabes de la Bibliothèque Nationale, 3682-5; Pertsch, Die orientalischen handschriften der Herzoglichen bibliothek zu Gotha, 2385-93. Vol. 1: Fols. 240; 29.3 x 19.5 cm.; written surface 24 x 12.5 cm.; 25 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with catchwords; headings in red. Beg.: بسم الله الرحمن الرحىم وبه نستعىن. الحمد لله الملك الجبار Colophon: تم النصف الاول من سىرة اسکندر ذي القرنىن ابن داراب الرومي والله الموفق للصواب والىه المرجع والمآب Marginal notes. On the page after the colophon occurs a statement that MS was copied A.H. 1176 [A.D. 1763]. MS in good condition but several folios are worm-eaten and mended; modern western binding. Vol. 2: Copied A.H. 1180 [A.D. 1767] by Muḥammad Abū Qāsim al-Qīrī [sic]. Fols. 176; 32.5 x 22.5 cm.; written surface 23 x 13 cm.; 25-28 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with catchwords. Marginal notes. MS in fair condition; Arabic leather binding with flap; color stamped and blind tooling on cover and flap.
author: Ṣūrī, Abū Isḥāq ibn Mufarraj

title.@value: سىرة الملك الاسکندر ذي القرنىن ووزىره السىد الولي الخضر.
Sīrat al-Malik al-Iskandar Dhī al-Qarnayn wa-wazīrihi al-Sayyid al-Walī al-Khiḍr...

creator: Ṣūrī, Abū Isḥāq ibn Mufarraj
subject: Alexander, the Great, 356-323 B.C.—Romances
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
